alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Morgan; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 3:21AM EDT until June 27 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Elliott County in east central Kentucky... Southeastern Rowan County in east central Kentucky... North Central Morgan County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 630 AM EDT. * At 321 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Up to an additional inch of rainfall may occur in the eastern portions of the warned area during the next half an hour to an hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sandy Hook, Minor, Lytten, Blairs Mills, Wagner, Fannin Valley, Hamm, Wagner Store, Farley, Wrigley, Little Sandy, Elliottville, Leisure, Craney, Pelfrey, Stark, Paragon and Lick Fork. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
